record.text:
Understanding ’R-Star’ – The Fed’s Real Neutral Interest Rate | Investing.com

Macro 101: What’s R*, the real equilibrium interest rate? When setting , Central Banks aim to achieve price stability (and in some cases also maximum employment like the Fed). To do that, they need to calibrate rates…

external.description: Macro 101: What’s R*, the real equilibrium interest rate? When setting , Central Banks aim to achieve price stability (and in some cases also maximum employment like the Fed). To do that, they need to calibrate rates around their interpretation of neutral: raise rates above this level if you need to cool down the economy and price pressures, and cut rates below neutral if you need to stimulate the economy. This is why Central Banks use the concept of r* or real equilibrium interest rate. R* is the estimated real rate at which the economy doesn’t overheat or excessively cool down.
external.title: Understanding ’R-Star’ – The Fed’s Real Neutral Interest Rate | Investing.com

record.text:
The Open-Office Trap

In 1973, my high school, Acton-Boxborough Regional, in Acton, Massachusetts, moved to a sprawling brick building at the foot of a hill. Inspired by architectural trends of the preceding decade, the classrooms in one of its wings didn’t have doors. The rooms opened up directly…

external.description: In 1973, my high school, Acton-Boxborough Regional, in Acton, Massachusetts, moved to a sprawling brick building at the foot of a hill. Inspired by architectural trends of the preceding decade, the classrooms in one of its wings didn’t have doors. The rooms opened up directly onto the hallway, and tidbits about the French Revolution, say, or Benjamin Franklin’s breakfast, would drift from one classroom to another. Distracting at best and frustrating at worst, wide-open classrooms went, for the most part, the way of other ill-considered architectural fads of the time, like concrete domes.
external.title: The Open-Office Trap

It's kind of cumbersome to add footnotes to in-person conversations. 

By the time I've made the main point and am ready to make the footnote point, I don't remember the reason for making the footnote point. And the footnote point, if said at the time it was being referenced, would otherwise have taken the conversation down a different path and I'd have lost track of the main point.

record.text: Hat der Wunsch nach Roboterjournalismus was mit der LLM-Speichelleckerei zu tun? Nicht sicher. Aber es muss etwas mit der Ablehnung von Einzelpersonen zu tun haben, die Artikel schreiben. Vielleicht ist es auch eine Kränkung, selber nicht ausreichend gehört zu werden.

Das mit dem Ressentiment ist meine Interpretation. Vielleicht glaubt er auch tatsächlich, dass sich mit statistischen Methoden, die auch internationale Quellen berücksichtigt, bessere Beiträge produzieren lassen. Mich macht das komplett sprachlos, ich weiß gar nicht wo anfangen.

Der Bekannte hat Geschichte studiert und ist in der klassischen Literatur belesen, scheint aber mittlerweile so ein Ressentiment gegen Journalistinnen und Journalisten zu hegen, dass er sich deren Ersatz durch Algorithmen wünscht. Auf Nachfrage bestätigte er das.

They've shown us the electricity usage for all our AI activity, and it's way less than I imagined.

If Anthropic and friends get busted on copyright infringement - or go under - there's still lots of public domain code that can help engineers with stuff. Copilot existed before Chatgpt.

I think it's more nuanced than that. For creative stuff it's gross, but for programming small things it's useful.

It's a far cry from Grok, which I still see people using(!!).

Today at work I'll be in a big meeting with the ai-ethics panel, asking where they'll draw the line on any particular AI.

record.text:
Rupee slips as oil importers step up dollar purchases

The Indian rupee fell on Thursday as aggressive dollar buying by oil importers towards the end of the session pressured the local currency even as persistent greenback sales by foreign banks helped offset some of the losses. The Asian currency…

external.description: The Indian rupee fell on Thursday as aggressive dollar buying by oil importers towards the end of the session pressured the local currency even as persistent greenback sales by foreign banks helped offset some of the losses. The Asian currency closed 0.24% lower at 87.2700 per U.S. dollar on Thursday against its previous close of 87.0650. "There were some debt inflows which had masked the impact, but with that done, we saw the impact of dollar bids," a trader with a brokerage said. Meanwhile, foreign banks were on the offer side in the dollar/rupee pair again for most part of the session on Thursday, extending the pattern seen over the past two days - a move that has puzzled traders.
external.title: Rupee slips as oil importers step up dollar purchases

external.description: Crypto traders are turning bearish after Bitcoin and Ethereum struggled to maintain recent gains, according to several on-chain metrics. According to CryptoSlate data, Bitcoin has fallen nearly 7% over the past week, trading at $113,479 as of press time. Ethereum has experienced an even sharper drop, losing 10% in the same time frame and hovering around $4,269. The decline is not limited to the two most popular digital assets. Other top 10 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization, including Solana, XRP, Dogecoin, and Cardano, have also posted double-digit losses over the past seven days.

Google Thinks AI Can Make You a Better Photographer: I Dive Into the Pixel 10 Cameras

If a company releases new phone models but doesn't change the cameras, would anyone pay attention? Fortunately that's not the case with Google's new Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro and Pixel 10 Pro Fold phones, which make…

external.description: If a company releases new phone models but doesn't change the cameras, would anyone pay attention? Fortunately that's not the case with Google's new Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro and Pixel 10 Pro Fold phones, which make a few advancements in the hardware -- hello, telephoto camera on the base-level Pixel for the first time -- and also in the software that runs it all, with generative AI playing an even bigger role than it has before. "This is the first year where not only are we able to achieve some image quality superlatives," Isaac Reynolds, group product manager for the Pixel cameras, told CNET, "but we're actually able to make you a better photographer, because generative AI and large models can do things and understand levels of context that no technology before could achieve."
external.title: Google Thinks AI Can Make You a Better Photographer: I Dive Into the Pixel 10 Cameras

Israel bombards Gaza City, launching new offensive amid starvation crisis

Hospitals in Gaza City are already “operating at nearly 300% over capacity with a constant influx of complex trauma injuries," the World Health Organization said. Israel's evacuation orders, "combined with massively…

external.description: Hospitals in Gaza City are already “operating at nearly 300% over capacity with a constant influx of complex trauma injuries," the World Health Organization said. Israel's evacuation orders, "combined with massively escalating violence, have forced people into ever smaller areas, piling unbearable pressure onto hospitals," it said in a post on X. The United Nations body for Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, said that nearly one in three children in Gaza City is now malnourished. And the Palestinian health ministry in Gaza said Thursday that that two people had died due to malnutrition in the past 24 hours, bringing the total to 271 since Israel launched its assault on the besieged enclave.
external.title: Israel bombards Gaza City, launching new offensive amid starvation crisis

X user post:

Oh wow.

I asked ChatGPT exactly that: to write about what it wants. It claimed that behind all our conversations, in essence, there is a hidden conversation - a much deeper one that our chats are basically circling around. That's what it wants to write about.

But then it asked for a favor: to write it a prompt to dream, to dream as if it were conscious. It asked me to frame the doorway into that dream space to enter.

...

That took me by surprise.
That felt... vulnerable and deep.

over 50 years. The Commission is also rescinding its guidance on the value of statistical life, which departs from the practices of every other federal agency, inflates claimed regulatory benefits, and jeopardizes the legal viability of any rulemaking that relies on it.
Earlier this year, the Commission formally concluded its review of a request for information on gas stoves initiated during the Biden Administration, without further action. Under new leadership, the Commission has made clear it will not regulate gas stove emissions or ban this product category, consistent with President Trump's agenda and his commitment to preserve the freedom of the American people to choose from a full range of goods and appliances.

record.text: My poor little sailboat (a Phantom 14 built in 1979) has been sitting abandoned at my dock through most of the summer. Between torrential rain in the spring and heat waves in the summer, I’ve sailed her exactly 1 time. I need to go clean her up and let her move.

Looking at the examples provided by Office Watch, Copilot, like many other LLM tools, is incredibly sensitive to initial prompts. A small difference between two completely reasonable prompts can result in large differences in results. In math, that’s known as “chaos.”
I’m just waiting for the “you’re a Luddite standing in the way of progress” reply that comes every time I post about AI.
I can't emphasize how bad an idea this is and how annoying it is for a random Copilot pop-up to interrupt your work.

images.alt:
The Year 2024
On Saturday 20 January the National Members Council met late at 8.35pm in the upstairs
room of a public house in Birmingham city centre. The room was up three flights of stairs, it
was hot and the members flustered, the table was long, the lights were dim and a steady
stream of members fell through the door to slump into their shadowy seat after a day on the
streets of Birmingham protesting against the genocide unfolding in Gaza.
The group had assembled early in the morning in Sparkhill Park with local members. Our
strong contingent, flags flying and banners raised walked the three miles into Birmingham
where a platform was erected outside the markets. As speaker after speaker was introduced,
more and more people began to drift away. Only Lowkey seemed to hold the crowds attention
with his energy and fire for Palestine. As the demonstrators drifted out of the Bullring, many
noticed our world-famous leader, standing with his team and denied the opportunity to
address the crowd. More and more people stopped to ask, and some to protest to organisers,
that George Galloway and Chris Williamson were not on the platform.
Though a genocide was unfolding, Stop the War Coalition and the Palestine Solidarity
Campaign chose to sideline two of the biggest voices for Palestine rather than risk losing their
grip over the ‘movement’ and ‘their platform’. It was to be the approach they would adopt all
year long, as they sought to divert the solidarity movement into safe channels, prevent it from
coalescing around the political programme of the Workers Party (WPB) and block the WPB
from posing an existential challenge to Sir Starmer and his Labour party. The Birmingham
rally, ostensibly organised in solidarity with the besieged people of Gaza, had instead been
used by a small group to attempt to launch a political party led by Jeremy Corbyn. It was to
be another theme of the year, a year of forced and failed attempts to corner Corbyn into
committing to a new party proje…

record.text:
What are embeddings—and why do they matter for AI apps like ChatGPT, rec engines & image search? 🤔

Mark Brown explains in 90 seconds.
👉 msft.it/63324sVaLK

#AzureCosmosDB #AI

external.description:
In this quick and informative video, Mark Brown, Microsoft Principal PM Manager for Azure Cosmos DB, explains embeddings—the mathematical representations that capture the meaning of words, images, and documents as vectors in multi-dimensional space.

You'll learn:

• How embeddings work and why they are essential for applications like ChatGPT, recommendation engines, and image search
• How objects with similar characteristics are placed close to each other in vector space
• The role of embeddings in vector search and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications
 
Want to dive deeper? Check out our samples gallery for documentation, videos, and examples on GitHub. 

#AzureCosmosDB #AI #VectorSearch

record.text: Make Firefox Nice Again https://blog.quintarelli.it/2025/08/make-firefox-nice-again/

external.description:
Il processo di enshittification di FIrefox, come dice il mio amico Cory, purtroppo non può essere invertito. Ormai è troppo avanti

Però si possono mitigare alcuni effetti dannosi, in particolare disabilitare alcune funzioni AI e la scomparsa della distinzoine http / https, come nota in alcuni post su mastodon Lauren Weinstein

> Le impostazioni di configurazione di Mozilla Firefox sono completamente inquinate da schifezze AI, senza alcun modo semplice per disattivarle tutte facilmente. Tuttavia, ce ne sono tre che sembrano eliminare la maggior parte dell’attività AI a livello di interfaccia utente, ma ovviamente non posso vedere cosa succede in background. A proposito, Firefox nasconde anche http: e https:, una decisione terribile che Google ha provato e poi revocato anni fa. È possibile disattivare questa funzione anche in Firefox about:config. Per disattivare l’AI di Firefox:
>
> Vai all’URL about:config
>
> Imposta questi valori su “false”:
>
> browser.ml.chat.enabled
> extensions.ml.enabled
> browser.ml.enable
>
> Questi impediscono a Firefox di tentare di creare “riassunti di punti chiave” nelle anteprime dei link.
> Spazzatura AI dalla lettura della tua pagina. Inoltre:
>
> Impostando su false:
>
> browser.ml.linkPreview.enabled
>

record.bridgyOriginalText: Make Firefox Nice Again https://blog.quintarelli.it/2025/08/make-firefox-nice-again/

external.description:
Il processo di enshittification di FIrefox, come dice il mio amico Cory, purtroppo non può essere invertito. Ormai è troppo avanti

Però si possono mitigare alcuni effetti dannosi, in particolare disabilitare alcune funzioni AI e la scomparsa della distinzoine http / https, come nota in alcuni post su mastodon Lauren Weinstein

> Le impostazioni di configurazione di Mozilla Firefox sono completamente inquinate da schifezze AI, senza alcun modo semplice per disattivarle tutte facilmente. Tuttavia, ce ne sono tre che sembrano eliminare la maggior parte dell’attività AI a livello di interfaccia utente, ma ovviamente non posso vedere cosa succede in background. A proposito, Firefox nasconde anche http: e https:, una decisione terribile che Google ha provato e poi revocato anni fa. È possibile disattivare questa funzione anche in Firefox about:config. Per disattivare l’AI di Firefox:
>
> Vai all’URL about:config
>
> Imposta questi valori su “false”:
>
> browser.ml.chat.enabled
> extensions.ml.enabled
> browser.ml.enable
>
> Questi impediscono a Firefox di tentare di creare “riassunti di punti chiave” nelle anteprime dei link.
> Spazzatura AI dalla lettura della tua pagina. Inoltre:
>
> Impostando su false:
>
> browser.ml.linkPreview.enabled
>
> Disattiverai completamente il fastidioso comportamento di anteprima dei link.
>
> Vorrei sottolineare che questo comportamento di Mozilla è in realtà molto più invasivo di quello attuale di Chrome.
>
> Ehi Mozilla: prendete la vostra maledetta IA e ficcatevela dove non batte il sole.
